other_tests.procedure_name: CT abdomen and pelvis with contrast
other_tests.findings: No suspicious liver lesions identified. 8mm hypodensity in Segment 4b of the liver which may represent inflammation related to ___ or a simple cyst/hemangioma. Peripancreatic inflammation involving the head and body of the pancreas with heterogeneous enhancement. Small-to-moderate amount of peripancreatic fluid, 2.2 x 8-mm filling defect in the third portion of the duodenum. Normal appearances of adrenals, spleen, and kidneys. 8-mm hypodense lesion in the left interpolar kidney, likely a simple cyst. Mild colonic wall thickening on the right likely related to adjacent inflammation and fluid.
